overview_of_class: Although American Jews make up a small percentage of the population, they have exerted an outsized influence on the entertainment and cultural media in this country. This class will follow key Jewish American writers and performers such as Fanny Brice, Arthur Miller, Woody Allen, Tony Kushner, Sarah Silverman and more. We will examine both primary sources (films, autobiographical excerpts, radio programs, standup routines, play-scripts, etc.) and scholarly analysis. The goal of this course is to develop critical thinking and persuasive writing addressing questions of assimilation, representation, stereotypes, and how what we see in the media impacts what we believe about people in our everyday lives.
